other_tests.findings: The gallbladder is distended and contains several small dependent gallstones. The wall is not thickened and there is no adjacent fluid. The biliary tree is normal in caliber, and there is no evidence of choledocholithiasis. A linear structure consistent with an aberrant bile duct is noted. The spleen is markedly enlarged measuring 20 cm. There are two small non-enhancing cystic lesions of the pancreatic body. Fatty infiltration of the hepatic parenchyma is indicated. There is a non-enhancing 11 mm area in the right kidney likely a non-obstructing calculus. A 2.5 cm simple cyst is noted in the lower pole of the left kidney.
